Trading212 CSV Import Guide

Learn how to import your Trading212 trading data via CSV into Pocket Portfolio for seamless portfolio tracking.

About Trading212

Commission-free trading platform

Required CSV Columns

Your Trading212 CSV export must include these columns:

  • Instrument
  • Action
  • Quantity
  • Price
  • Value

Sample CSV Format

Instrument,Action,Quantity,Price,Value
AAPL,BUY,10,150.00,1500.00

Step-by-Step Import Guide

Step 1: Export Your Data

Log into your Trading212 account and navigate to the export or account statement section. Download your trading history or account statement as a CSV file.

Step 2: Verify Required Columns

Ensure your CSV contains the required columns listed above. If any columns are missing or named differently, you may need to rename them or export a different report from Trading212.

Step 3: Sign In to Pocket Portfolio

Sign in to Pocket Portfolio using your Google account to access the CSV import feature. No registration required - just click "Sign in with Google".

Step 4: Upload Your CSV

Navigate to the dashboard and use the "Import CSV" feature to upload your exported data. Pocket Portfolio will automatically detect the Trading212 format and map the columns.

Step 5: Verify Import

Review your imported trades and positions to ensure everything looks correct. You can edit or delete individual trades if needed.

Tips & Troubleshooting

  • Use the "Export" feature in Trading212
  • Include both buy and sell transactions
  • Check that instrument symbols are correct

Ready to Import Your Trading212 Data?

Sign in to Pocket Portfolio and import your Trading212 trading data in minutes.

Sign in with GoogleImport CSV Now
